boardgame.name: Kings of War: The Battle for Ironhold – Two Player Battle Set
boardgame.description:
Since ancient times, the world has been ravaged by war. The wise foresee an age of horror approaching, for the spirit of the earth is sick, tainted by deadly sorcery in a great conflict ages past. Not that the warlords of this bloody era care, not while there is glory to be won, territory to be wrested from the enemy, foes to be slaughtered. The so-called Noble Peoples – Men, Elves and Dwarfs – now struggle for power and influence, battling across the ruins of long-dead realms, or staking claim to new lands. Their ancient pacts are no more. The kingdoms that pledged their armies in service of those sacred treaties are gone into legend, the descendants of the noble princes who swore eternal oaths of friendship warring openly with one another. The glorious empires of those days are lost to the ocean, or buried beneath shifting sands, the palaces of the wise now home to kraken or shambling revenants, while the scions of their great houses are exiled or long-dead...

This set contains a Kings of War 2nd Edition Gamer’s Rulebook, and 93 multi-part plastic Undead and Dwarf miniatures, including:

1 Skeleton Regiment
20 Skeleton Warriors
Hand Weapons and Shields or Spears and Shields
Command components including Standard Bearer and Musician.
Undead Dog
20 Zombies
10 Ghouls
20 Ironclad
10 Ironwatch
10 Shieldbreakers
1 Ironbelcher Cannon/Organ Gun with Crew
Square Bases

Miniatures are supplied unpainted and assembly may be required.

boardgame.name: Das lustige 7-Hühnchen-Spiel
boardgame.description: The players start at the red space near space 1. The first to reach the red space at the henhouse wins the game. Movement is determined by a spinner or die. On the numbered spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

boardgame.name: Summit 2030
boardgame.description:
Summit 2030 is a board game where players reflect, discuss and vote to bring the issues of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development to global attention.

The 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda, together with their 169 goals, address the issue of sustainability from different points of view taking into account, for example, education, health, gender equality, job opportunities, climate change, environmental protection.

By playing Summit 2030, participants will be able to identify with some of the stakeholders involved in the Agenda implementation process. The main purpose of the game is to bring the SDG of one’s chosen role (stakeholder) to the highest level of discussion, that is global attention.

Using cards you move your SDGs up on the scale. When an SDG reaches the top step, a vote begins. If all the players vote in favor, the round ends and the points are calculated. If even one player votes against, the SDG is placed on the lowest step and the round continues. Players have a limited number of votes against in each round.

The game ends after completing the third round, or at the end of any round chosen as the last one. The player with the highest score is the winner. In the event of a tie, the players share the win.

Summit 2030 is freely inspired by Stefano Luperto’s “King Up”.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Хайдути
boardgame.description:
During the Ottoman rule of the Bulgarian lands, the hajduks (Хайдути), thousands of unwavering men and women would embark on the terrible, but glorious path to freedom.
In the 1860s and 1870s, when the game is set, the Bulgarian revolutionary movement was at its peak.

There are three game modes - short, medium and long. Three important indicators of the game must be monitored - Recruitment, Activity and Combat Power. They are all tracked on the "committee board" in front of each player. The Winner of Хайдути will be the one who gathers the most powerful detachment of freedom fighters, which depends on the strength of his committee.
During a turn, players can choose different types of revolutionaries, form groups and encounter Ottoman guards, all done in a certain order. Also, they will be able to recruit real Bulgarian historical figures, like Vasil Levski, who have skills inspired by their life path.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 Bulgarian Board Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: A Rainy Night in Chinatown
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The goal for the players is simple. They are tasked by `CashByte Myke´, a local fixer to venture into the heart of Chinatown to secure payment of a long overdue debt. `Gwai the Barber´, a well-known character from the district received a considerable loan with stratospheric interest that remains unpaid. `CashByte´ knows the dangers the alleys of Chinatown hold, so he prefers to send in some dispensable debt collectors. He offers the players a sizeable commission, provided the debt is paid in full. If the barber offers more excuses, the sight of one of his open razors with blood gushing from his cheek will soon change his mind.

boardgame.name: The Dragon Strikes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventure is system-neutral, meaning it can be used with any rule system with minimal application. The aim is to provide a readymade storyline, content and ideas for Gamemasters. This will enable them to focus their attention on running their game with minimal preparation.

The Dragon Strike continues the story of the Triad war in Chinatown, between `Tseng Society´ and the `Flaming Sword Society´. These two warring Triad factions are ready to battle it out on the busy streets of Chinatown. Soon the chatter of vendors and hawkers will be replaced with the sound of gunfire and bullets ricocheting back and forth.

boardgame.name: Kentaro's Revenge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

`Kentaro´s Revenge´ is a Cyberpunk revenge story RPG adventure. It is system-neutral, meaning it can be used with any rule system with minimal application. The aim is to provide a readymade storyline, content and ideas for Gamemasters. This will enable them to focus their attention on running their game with minimal preparation.

Over the course of 8 missions the players will aid `Kentaro´ in his vengeance mission against `Hikona Corp´. They will battle combat drones, corporate security, death squad members and the dreaded `Behemoth´.

boardgame.name: Showdown in Chinatown
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Showdown in Chinatown” is a system-agnostic RPG Adventure. The aim is to provide a readymade storyline, content and ideas for Game Masters. This will enable them to concentrate on running their game with minimal preparation. They can also add their own stats for enemies.

The player characters are tasked to retrieve a hard drive but find themselves within the crossfire of two warring Triad Societies.

boardgame.name: The Planar Tome of Arcane Backgrounds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arcane Backgrounds from Across the Multiverse

The Planar Tome of Arcane Backgrounds is a trove of new player options from BPB Games. Stuffed with new Arcane Backgrounds, associated Edges, new Powers, and new Power Modifiers, The Planar Tome of Arcane Backgrounds is an absolute must have for groups who want their Arcane Backgrounds to look, feel, and mechanically play differently than one-another.

What's in The Planar Tome of Arcane Backgrounds?

11 NEW Arcane Backgrounds with unique Backlash and options
38 NEW Edges unique to the new Arcane Backgrounds
11 NEW Powers with unique Modifiers
16 NEW Power Modifiers for existing Powers
16 Stat Blocks at different Ranks to represent spellcasters and new summons!

boardgame.name: Banners
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the Hunt Master reaper archetype, the Symbol of Valor Vigilante archetype, and 4 new feats, Spheres Apocrypha: Banners gives you all sorts of new ways to hold your banner high and become a beacon for your allies!

For Spheres of Power and Spheres of Might and Pathfinder 1st edition. Go beyond with Spheres Apocrypha!

boardgame.name: Shaerael
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Citadel of Shaerael was a well-known landmark, administered by a respected lord. Unfortunately, his steward — a wicked man and a secret practitioner of the black arts — secretly betrayed Shaerael to an enemy power. The plan went into motion, resulting in the lord’s death. But the enemy leader, having ambitions of his own, turned on the steward, who in turn tried to defend himself with dark magic.

Something went wrong. All within were slain, and Shaerael itself disappeared. But every so often, when the stars align right on the night of the full moon, the citadel reappears, looking as though not a day had passed. Rumors abound that a great treasure is within, but a terrible curse awaits any who dare its walls…

Shaerael is a short fantasy adventure for Of Realms Unbounded: 2D6 Adventure in an Age of Sword and Spell.

boardgame.name: Theurgy: Homeshard
boardgame.description:
My entry for the Beak, Feather and Bone game jam.

This hack of the system is intended for use with Theurgy: Afterward, a game still in development. It can be used to create small to large fantasy settings with a variety of features. You play from the perspective of a Kedge, a spirit that had a hand in creation of this place and watches over it.

To play you need the following materials:

This document
Writing utensils
Note cards
A standard 52 card deck of playing cards
A token to indicate where the Storyteller Shrine is located
Tokens for each player to place on the map as they play cards


This is my first game jam entry, I would really appreciate feedback if you have any for me, thanks.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Aeon's End: reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description:
Version A is intended as a first insert for this game (Aeon's End or Aeon's End: War Eternal). Version A, in addition to the card and gate trays, includes two token trays that can hold the tokens of two base games (Aeon's End or Aeon's End: War Eternal) and four expansions (Depths, Nameless, Void, Outer Dark). All heroes and Nemesis cards from the aforementioned base games and expansions will also fit into this version. The containers for tokens are slided - nothing will fall out when the box is stored vertically.

Version B is intended as a second insert for the other base game (Aeon's End or Aeon's End: War Eternal). It complements the space needed to store cards. It includes an additional gate tray and one of the card trays is a card holder.

boardgame.name: Enchantement, Vanité, & Tendresse
boardgame.description:
You and your compatriots have united around a common goal in service of your liege, the Queen of Hearts: liberate Le Palais de L’Amour, so that the people of your land may unfreeze their hearts and find romance again. Successfully besieging Le Palais will benefit each one of you, but the Queen has promised special influence and favor to whoever blossoms most under her adoring gaze.

Enchantement, Vanité, & Tendresse is a romantic new take on Tyler Crumrine’s map-labeling game Beak, Feather, & Bone, inspired by Georg Matthaüs Seutter’s “Allegorical Map of the Siege of the Castle of Love,” published in 1735.

Players start with an unlabeled map of a besieged heart, and are assigned community roles that represent the stakeholders in the battle for Le Palais de L’Amour — the Castle of Love.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Cabbage!
boardgame.description:
Two farmers compete for the largest cabbage field. The player who after 6 turns has the largest number of connected cabbages in their color wins the game.

Cabbage! is a quick to play game that presents a particularly colorful and tasty challenge. Optimize the cabbage field with only 6 moves (either flip, rotate or replace), outwit your opponent and become the glorious king or queen of cabbage!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Dinosaur Bingo
boardgame.description: A variant of bingo, each player has a board with a 4x4 grid of 16 dinosaurs. The caller randomly picks one of 48 different dinosaur tiles for the players to match. The first player to fill their card of 16 is the winner.

boardgame.name: Great Western Trail: Kolej na Północ – reDrewno Overlay
Great Western Trail: Rails to the North – reDrewno Overlay

boardgame.name: Great Western Trail: reDrewno Overlay
boardgame.description: Overlay for the player board.

boardgame.name: 5 Minutes More
boardgame.description:
In a very, very remote jungle a group of sloths have gathered under the light of the full moon for the great dream party.

During this celebration they will share an intense nap in which these experienced dreamers will perceive and handle 3 types of energy:

Pink Energy - Helps you to fall asleep and dreaming without interruptions.
Yellow energy - Allows you to control your dreams and / or alter those of others.
Blue energy - It goes beyond the dream itself. It makes you wake up happy and refreshed.

Only those who manage to master these energies through the different stages of the dream cycle can aspire to become the next Master!

Show that you live your dreams to the fullest!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Gods of Aach'yn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of Aach'yn is a beautiful and dangerous place full of lush jungles, biodiverse wetlands, and silt seas. The gods and The Autarch often find themselves at odds with one another, to the dismay and wonderment of the poor mortals caught in the middle.

This book details the good, bad, and neutral gods along with a special entry on The Autarch himself.

boardgame.name: Plants of Aach'yn Field Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of Aach'yn is a beautiful and dangerous place full of lush jungles, biodiverse wetlands, and silt seas. One thing is common across the world... there are plants, herbs, and flowers everywhere. Some are helpful, some are poisonous, and some want to eat you.

This field guide details some of the common plants you may encounter, and some of the more rare/exotic varieties, along with their in-game effects and color illustrations.

boardgame.name: Portents of Doom: Rise of the Snake God
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rivers turned to blood. Farms overrun with monstrous snakes eating the livestock (and the farmers!) Roving bands of undead appearing outside the capital city of T’chel. High above Aach’yn in his floating castle, The Autarch ignores the signs, but the sages are worried — and they have a job for you.

WELCOME TO THE JUNGLE

The followers of Ququmatz, a particularly xenophobic and cruel sect of Azites, are trying to wake their evil snake god and bring it into this world. If they succeed, war comes to Aach’yn. Your mission is simple: enter Aztlan undetected, find and explore the temple, and stop the ritual (or die trying.) Do you have what it takes to succeed? You better hope so, because the fate of the world hangs in the balance.

This module includes a cover folder with maps and a booklet with all information necessary to run the adventure Portents of Doom — Rise of the Snake God in either standalone or campaign mode.

boardgame.name: Tail, Scale, & Bone
boardgame.description:
Following Beak, Feather, & Bone’s release in February 2020, it’s been amazing seeing all of the wonderful ravenfolk cities Austin Breed's illustrations have inspired. And I hope to see many more! But with players using the same community portraits in each of their games, I’ve also started to notice some similarities between sessions. Maybe you have too!

One of the fun things about BFB, though, is that you’re by no means tied to using the core game’s factions. In fact, inserting new communities or even just pulling inspiration from different illustrations can help you interpret Jonathan Yee’s map in whole new ways.

That’s where Elizabeth Orji-Smith comes in! By shifting the game’s communities from ravenfolk to merfolk in Tail, Scale, & Bone, players are reminded there’s no reason the city’s map can’t be on the bottom of the ocean. In fact, it could just as easily be on the moon!

What’s more, Elizabeth has created 10 entirely new communities for players to represent in the game, helping you push BFB’s replayability even further. Feel free to mix and match as well—imagining how ravenfolk Couriers might behave or adding merfolk Miners to your underwater game.

While the core BFB rules remain under copyright, we encourage artists to create and sell their own supplements as well! Feel free to use this as a template. Furthermore, while TSB’s illustrations were made for this system, there’s nothing stopping them from inspiring NPCs for your home campaigns either!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Ascidiae
boardgame.description:
In Ascidiae you control a thriving colony of ascidians, tiny marine immobile animals, and race to establish new colonies on neighbouring rocks.

In this assembly-line puzzle, players use their ascidiae to spawn tadpoles, and their tadpoles to create new tadpoles and ascidiae through metamorphosis. Get the right group of tadpoles to establish a new colony, and claim to colonies to win the game!

Card ascidiae are placed on a grid in each player's board,
mostly immobile, and activate following the zig-zagging aquatic currents. Wooden tadpoles are placed on the cards and change and travel according to each ascidian habilities.

Each ascidia has its own different habilities, and can be initial (each player starts with two), common (all games have these) or special (six chosen from more than 25); with colonies that come in three difficulty levels and different player boards, game possibilities are endless.

boardgame.name: Wilderness Encounters (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

13 Adventuring locations out in the trackless wilderness! (For any RPG)

What lurks in the great outdoors? Now's your chance to find out - If you're brave enough...

Wilderness Enounters takes you and your players out of the city and back into the woods, the wilds, the deserts and far from the madding crowd. Includes a Lamia's Lair, The Tomb of the Vashkari, A Troll Hole, the Maze of the Man-Bull, a Haunted Pool with Ruins, a Giant Hornet's Nest, A Serpantmen's Nest and many more. Like the Citybooks, each location is described with characters, creatures, locations, maps and some scenario suggestions.

Plus we've added over 20 more pages of content including a detailed Land Type generator and description guide that you can use to teleport players to random locations and immeditately be able to describe each of the 12 locations in rich detail to your players. You can also use it to help inspire you to create your own locations for running GM adventures.

For ANY Fantasy Role Playing System, and not just thinly. All the descriptions and mechanics are in generic terms so it will fit in with whatever campaign system you are using.

boardgame.name: Dealing With Your Demons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dealing With Your Demons is a 5E OGL adventure in two-parts. Part One is designed for levels 1-4 and Part Two is designed for levels 4-8. The first part of the adventure has the party delving into a classic dungeon, intent on rooting out long-lost treasures. However, things are not quite what they seem and the demon the party destroys in the first act may be something quite different from what they are led to believe. The adventure is designed to be placed into any setting, though it does present a city, Par-Lar Dur, and some locations that can be modified to meet many needs.

At its heart, Dealing With Your Demons is a story about cultural misunderstanding and colonialism, but told through a classic dungeon crawling lens. It's also a story about kobolds, one of our favorite species in all fantasy RPGs. The second half of Dealing With Your Demons is a trek to discover the truth about the first act and a fight to restore one's honor in the face of misunderstanding and misdeed. Contrition must be made before the party is utterly destroyed by kobolds who don't have a lot of mercy in their hearts. Dealing With Your Demons provides a significant cultural background to the kobolds at the center of this story, diving into their religious and cultural integration into the greater world of this story. This adventure is designed using the RORPG method, that's the Reach Out Roleplaying Games method designed to allow for intercultural dialogue using TTRPGs.

boardgame.name: Trick or Treat 2020
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Joyeuse Toussaint !

Enjoy a one of a kind treat. Unless it's a trick? Who knows.

boardgame.name: Ladies of Darkness Volume 1: Physical Ladies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ladies of Darkness is a new series of books about women (or people on that side of the gender spectrum). The series will have different volumes. Mortal volumes 1, 2 and 3 will be centered around physical, social and mental characters, followed by other volumes turning these characters into different types of supernaturals for the different gamelines of the World of Darkness.

This books contains five characters on the womanhood spectrum of gender. These mortal characters will be great encounters, bases for PCs or NPCs, future vampires, ghouls, awakened mages, werewolves that may have not had their first change yet, future victims or ghosts, or just regular inhabitants of your city. After all, the supernatural make such a tiny proportion of the World of Darkness...

You'll get to meet five badass physically oriented ladies: a craftswoman, a courier, a model and choreographer, a fitness coach and a skater brat.

boardgame.name: Ladies of Darkness Volume 2: Social Ladies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ladies of Darkness is a new series of books about women (or people on that side of the gender spectrum). The series will have different volumes. Mortal volumes 1, 2 and 3 will be centered around physical, social and mental characters, followed by other volumes turning these characters into different types of supernaturals for the different gamelines of the World of Darkness.

This books contains five characters on the womanhood spectrum of gender. These mortal characters will be great encounters, bases for PCs or NPCs, future vampires, ghouls, awakened mages, werewolves that may have not had their first change yet, future victims or ghosts, or just regular inhabitants of your city. After all, the supernatural make such a tiny proportion of the World of Darkness...

You'll get to meet five badass socially oriented ladies: an alternative beauty, a community attorney, a madame, a frontline punk, and a hijabi icon.

boardgame.name: Ladies of Darkness Volume 3: Smart Ladies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ladies of Darkness is a new series of books about women (or people on that side of the gender spectrum). The series will have different volumes. Mortal volumes 1, 2 and 3 will be centered around physical, social and mental characters, followed by other volumes turning these characters into different types of supernaturals for the different gamelines of the World of Darkness.

This books contains five characters on the womanhood spectrum of gender. These mortal characters will be great encounters, bases for PCs or NPCs, future vampires, ghouls, awakened mages, werewolves that may have not had their first change yet, future victims or ghosts, or just regular inhabitants of your city. After all, the supernatural make such a tiny proportion of the World of Darkness...

You'll get to meet five badass brainy oriented ladies: an experienced cataphile, a rootless uni lecturer, an anti-corruption journalist, a tech problem solver, and a jaded tenured teacher.

boardgame.name: Ladies of Darkness: Ghouls & Vampires
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This volume, Ghouls and Vampires, takes a look at how vampires might look at these mortal characters.

Fifteen ladies encounter the supernatural

This book contains the presentation of the fifteen Ladies of Darkness characters as potential tools for vampires to use, from a biased, more or less misinformed presentator. You'll find how each of them could be ghouled or embraced by key canon figures of the World of Darkness, with some misconceptions, errors and tensions.

You'll also find matching stat blocks for each situation to make their character sheets become the character sheet of a playable Neonate Vampire or of a playable and ready to use Ghoul. These characters make for great PCs at your table.

The use of the mortal version Ladies of Darkness books is necessary, as they're the bases for them becoming ghouls or vampires, but the misinformation can help you piece what they were if needed.

Minor adjustments will be needed to adapt to your city, and add merits and flaws if you want them.

Here's what you'll find:

Why would one Embrace and not Ghoul, as well as different motives to do either (other than "accident" or "mass embrace"),
An in character presentation of all fifteen characters, with personal notes,
Backgrounds for all characters to either become ghouls or vampires,
Extra domitors and sires for different stats add-ons,
Some other stats to add to the character if they're the victim of a mass embrace, an accidental embrace, or being abandonned, and survive their fledgling moments

boardgame.name: Twists of Obscenity: Esoterica of the Baali
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Infernal Rising
As bad as you thought the Baali were, you had no idea. Lurking in the bleakest shadows of Oblivion, coiled in Abyss-pits of melting soul-rot, they wait. They wait, and they scheme, and they build their unholy numbers, slowly and deliberately corrupting the incorruptible. Brokering deals on behalf of their demonic masters, or forging obscene bargains of their own, the Baali — true evil in a twisted world of moral grays — are slowly bringing the Outer Darkness directly to Earth, one night at a time.

Hell’s got nothing on us ...
Included within are rules for several new splinter bloodlines of the Baali — including the nightmare-summoning Yomonlik and the devil-in-flesh Akahaete — new Combination Disciplines, new Merits and Flaws, more than a dozen Storyteller Characters, and a new system for Infernal Investments. There are also new morality paths: no Infernalist should try to maintain her Humanity. You’ll also find strange new Disciplines providing your wicked characters more variety and customization than has ever been seen among Vampires.

With this book, your chronicle — whether you stand against the legions of Hell or seek to command their foul contagion — can transcend new levels of utter depravity.

boardgame.name: Ivory Tower: Concise Guide to the Camarilla
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Knife in the Back

Welcome to the Camarilla. If you don't already have a knife behind your back, don't fret; one will show up in there soon enough. Politics in the Camarilla are dangerous, and notoriously difficult to navigate. But with a bit of learning, and a bit of careful maneuvering, you can learn to steer through the halls of power, earning boons and status, gaining power for yourself.

The Threads of Power

Learn how to navigate through the various positions in the Camarilla. Also learn new backgrounds, new combination disciplines, new merits and flaws, new derangements, and alternate rules for status, boons, and Elysium.

boardgame.name: Wyld Ways: Guide to Garou Politics
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heart of the Pack

The Garou must learn to work together. For thousands of years, they have lived and worked on septs, forming positions and learning the basics of politics in their world. They have developed systems of challenge, made deals with spirits, and built defensible homes to keep the Wyrm from spreading too far. Modern septs are more multitribal, which brings new challenges, new difficulties. A new opportunity to learn to work together, or the last straw that breaks Gaia’s back? Only you can decide.

Rend by Claws

Included in this volume are explanations for the various positions in a sept, examples of rank challenges, and rules for everything from challenge to the High Tongue. There are also discussions of the way different tribes interpret the Litany. And many new totems, along with fetishes, talens, merits and flaws, and sample NPCs to help spice up your werewolf campaign.

boardgame.name: Tribebook: The Unwanted
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unwanted, Unseen, Unexpected

The edges of the Garou world have always been frayed. Whether it be those who leave their tribes, those who use ancient magic to become Garou, or those who wandered too far and lost themselves in the Umbra, there are more creatures out there than the Garou want to believe. But those other creatures are out there, waiting, surviving, and plotting.

Everything that was Lost can be found

Included are rules for the Skin Dancers, the Ronin, and a new group, the Lost. Advice on how to run campaigns with these creatures as antagonists, as well as rules for having player characters from each of the groups. There are new rules for the creation of each group, as well as new Merits and Flaws, new Rituals, Gifts, Totems, and rules for tribal benefits and drawbacks.

boardgame.name: Nuwisha's Guide to the Umbra
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Reflections on the world’s reflection

Nuwisha's Guide to the Umbra is an exploration of the umbral realms for Werewolf: the Apocalypse. Take an in-character tour through the realms, learn new gifts, find new totems, new talens, new fetishes, new rituals, and rules for travelling between realms and surviving within them.

Want to go on a trip?

Hey there, mate. My name is Isaac Babbit. I’m a Nuwisha. One of the good ones. I’ll take you on a tour through the Umbra, show you things you’ve never seen before. And I promise, I’ll keep you safe, and bring you back when we’re done. No charge.

boardgame.name: Den Parents
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Like Herding Cats

Everyone needs to start somewhere. And Garou do not start alone. Instead, they start with someone else. A teacher. A caretaker. A protector. They start with a Den Parent. They start with you. And regardless of the chaos they cause, you are the one who has to clean it all up.

Ambassador of the Game

This book discusses all the important roles that the Den Parent plays in a MET game, including the out of character role that is invested in the position. Along with advice and explanation, there are new backgrounds, rituals, talens, fetishes, gifts, and even totems to help spice up your game and help everyone have a good time.
boardgame.rpg: Laws of the Wild (1st and 2nd Editions)

boardgame.name: It's a Wonderful World: Leisure & Decadence
It's a Wonderful World: Loisirs & Décadence
boardgame.description:
A second campaign expansion for It's A Wonderful World... six scenarios and hidden content to add to the base game is included.

This is not a legacy game - though there are surprises the first time it is played. The cards can be reset and the campaign played again.

Originally part of the Corruption & Ascension Kickstarter, it is available directly from the publisher.

Contents
150 cards
11 Scenario leaflets
6 Scenario enveloppes
4 secret boxes, including 27 secret components
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: It's a Wonderful World: Heritage Edition

boardgame.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 254 - Apr 2021)
boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue No. 254
April 2021

Shadowrun - Getting Wyrd!

boardgame.name: Rumors, Cliques, & History
boardgame.description:
A hack of Tyler Crumrine’s Beak, Feather, & Bone, a collaborative world/map building RPG. You’ll be creating a unique community steeped in folklore and strange occurrences, drawn from the perspective of the grade-school youth who inhabit it.

Rumors, Cliques, & History can be played as a self-contained RPG or session zero tool for establishing the communities you encounter during play.

Within the game you’ll be representing a grade-school clique and building the city through the lens of how they would explore and experience it. On your turn you’ll flip a card, choose which location type to represent on the map, describe the location in a few short sentences, and then draw the location directly onto the hex map. You’ll not only determine the relationship of the location within the map, you’ll also create the narrative in which this location exists and how it is influenced by or influences your clique.

To Play You’ll Need

location details sheets (provided) OR a stack of note cards
colored writing utensils OR writing utensils AND coloring utensils
an unlabeled hex map (provided)
a standard 52 deck playing cards


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Time, Void, and Travel
boardgame.description:
Time, Void, and Travel is a moderately competitive map-labeling game based on the popular Beak, Feather, and Bone by Tyler Crumrine and inspired by the map-tile art installation Jerry’s Map by Jerry Gretzinger.

In this game, players are living in a city where time has just been warped and the entire city is transported into the Past. As your communities explore the city to figure out what happened, you realize that time and space are still shifting. The city is fragmented into sections that are in different time periods and some sections that are completely empty.

The three kinds of sections you find are:

The Past by what looks to be about 1560s (500-600 years in the past).
The Present which looks exactly like the 21st century city they remember
The Void which looks like an endless empty space save for the interfaces with other sections. Although this Void looks empty, you have a sense that there is something behind all the nothingness.

Players will explore the various fragments of their city, determine what they look like, and eventually figure out what has caused the city to become time warped. This game uses almost all of the same base rules as Beak, Feather, and Bone, but adds additional mechanics to create space-time warps and voids.

Source: The Developer Website.

Game Trade Magazine

Magi Nation: Duel CCG

boardgame.name: Time is Come Round: The Contagion Chronicle Jumpstart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world suffers from illness. It shivers and shudders as the Contagion takes hold. In Houston, Texas, a woman has gone missing and you’re the ones to find and rescue her. But all is not what it seems. Prepare to draw back the curtains and peek backstage.

Welcome to the Chronicles of Darkness. A world like our own, but uglier, more brutal — infinitely more dangerous. This world can’t survive long against its disease. Perhaps you can provide a cure.

Time is Come Round includes:

Rules for playing mortals caught in the supernatural webs of the Chronicles of Darkness.
A complete adventure for you to play right out of the book, with four full, pre-generated characters.
A preview of rules from the Chronicles of Darkness Second Edition core rulebook.

boardgame.name: Keepers of the Questar
boardgame.description:
The enigmatic Quest Masters of Arbandy left many mysterious quests in their wake but the most coveted of all is an unrivaled treasure known as the Questar. Tavern tales and oracles of old have said that mortal artistry pales in comparison to the Questar's beauty.

Now competing parties of adventurers have formed to take on the Quest Masters' quests and become the Keepers of the Questar…..They are inviting you to embark on this journey and collect the Questar for you very own! But beware, hidden dangers lurk within dungeons encumbered by traps and monsters; ready to destroy the unwary adventurer! Traps and monsters can be exposed, but can you avoid them all?

This is a 1 vs 1 dungeon crawler. You will play as both the Adventurer and Quest Master as you face off against your opponent in a race to be the first to compete your opponent's designed map.

Contents: 8 Adventurer Cards, 8 Double Sided Maps, 2 Quest Master Screens, 1 Quest Sheet, Pad Tokens: 36 Monsters, 28 Traps, 4 Wellsprings, 4 Entrance Portals, 4 Exit Portals, 4 Chests, 4 Questars, 12 Combat/Ability, 24 Experience (XP), 38 Health Damage, 4 Party Markers, 2 Token Bags, Rulebook.

-Publisher's Blurb

The game is played between two opponents, each maintaining a secret map with plotted locations (traps, monsters, etc.). Players alternate moving their explorer units on the board, encountering obstacles as they progress. Tokens, dice, and cards are used to resolve conflict situations. The first player to locate and obtain the opponent's Questar wins.

-user summary

listing.notes: Title: Keepers of the Questar Publisher: Upper Deck Entertainment Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Bayou Bash
boardgame.description:
As gremlins climb on rocks and wade in puddles to catch a glimpse of the big race, their favorite racers gear up at the starting line. Time to find out who’s the fastest, and more importantly, who’s the fan favorite!

Bayou Bash is a chaotic racing game for 2-4 players filled with rambunctious racers who will do anything to win over the most fans before crossing the finish line. Each player takes control of a racer with unique abilities, and must battle for victory across the customizable track while gaining fans along the way. In Bayou Bash, it’s not about who crosses the finish line first, but who pulls off the craziest tricks during the race!

—description from the publisher

Players are represented by one of four tokens, each with variable special ability. The play surface is customizable, allowing for a variety of racetracks. Starting condition cards add additional random elements into the game. Each turn, players draft cards that control movement, provide supplies, etc. The first player to cross the finish line ends the game but it’s the player with the most fans who wins. Cheap shots are encouraged.

—user summary

listing.notes: Title: Bayou Bash Publisher: Wyrd Miniatures Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Staves
boardgame.description:
Staves is a game where 2 to 6 players play elemental staff sections to build magickal staves for the Mages' Guild.

Each player has hidden clients paying them extra to make sure the staves are to their specific liking. Players play elemental staff pieces from their hands to the common play area, one per turn, to help determine the elemental patterns for each staff, then draw a new Staves card once they have played. If a player can't play any card in their hand, they may draw one Staves card and play it if possible. New staves can be started by playing a "Foot" card, and staves are completed by playing a "Crown" card of the next element in the pattern. Once any six staves have been completed, the game ends and the clients are revealed for end-of-the-game scoring. The player who earns the most gold wins!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Wonderland Fluxx
boardgame.description:
Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game.

In Wonderland Fluxx, you get to go down the Rabbit Hole to join Alice as she has tea with the Mad Hatter, gets directions from the Cheshire Cat, tries to reason with Tweedle Dee and Tweedle Dum, and grows and shrinks alarmingly. You may even need to slay a Jabberwock to win at this even curiouser version of Fluxx...

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Эвакуация
boardgame.description:
Эвакуация, Evacuation

A terrible explosion took place in the city.
The metropolis turned into hell.
Millions of people have gone missing...
and only the most persistent will be able to get out of this hell...
Can you become one of them ?

Gameplay:
each player leads a group of 6 refugees, whom he must lead along a narrow and dangerous road among the ruins from the explosion to the rescue point: the bus.
In order for a group of people to survive, to be able to leave for another country without loss, the player must, on its way out, collect a gas mask, a first aid kit and a backpack with food, but only those that are on special cards.
Each player during the game will receive cards with tips on how to run to the bus.

Victory:
Everyone wants to survive, but there is only enough room on the bus for one group.
As soon as someone's group is completely gathered near the bus, he/she wins, everyone else loses!

boardgame.name: Occurrence at JCR Outpost
boardgame.description:
A scientific mission in Antarctica goes wrong when something is released from beneath the ice.

Source: The Developer Website.

Developed by Brandon Brizzi.

boardgame.name: Monopol: Malmö
boardgame.description:
The popular real estate game has arrived in Malmö, Sweden.

Walk around the town and find beautiful streets, interesting cultural institutions, companies and outdoor areas all for sale.
Who doesn't want to own the magnificent Malmö Opera House, Turning Torso Skyscraper, Möllevångstorgið, Cosmopol Casino or Eyrarsundsbrún?
The way to victory is to show foresight, invest well and make good deals.
The one who accumulates the most wealth and acquires the whole town stands out as the winner.

boardgame.name: Indianapolis In-A-box
boardgame.description: Indianapolis In-A-Box is a board game based on the GREAT city of Indianapolis. We chose some favorite landmarks (Circle Center Monument) and traditions (State Fair), mixed in a big race (Indy 500 race car), lots of basketball, traffic jams, keys to the city, BIG FUN! and voilà (vwa la) - behold; there it is Indianapolis In-A-Box.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: ... in a Box (Late for the Sky)

boardgame.name: Fragments
boardgame.description:
Fragments is a supplement for Beak, Feather, & Bone that provides new rules for dynamic map building for the game. A copy of BFB is required to play.

A submission for the #BFBJAM.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Orcs! Dicing with Death
boardgame.description:
Orcs! Dicing with Death is a push-your-luck gambling dice game designed by The Guild of Good Games primarily to be played in the live action roleplaying world of Empire by Profound Decisions. No knowledge of LARP or Empire is required to play or enjoy the game.

The game starts with a “Pit Fight” set-up phase during which players determine the order of play for the main “Battle” phase. The Battle consists of several rounds during which each player in turn rolls dice to try to defeat barbarian orcs and collect coins as booty, before either taking casualties or deciding to withdraw from battle in order to avoid casualties. Whoever has collected the most coins when all the barbarian orcs are defeated wins the game.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: New Card Rules
boardgame.description:
New Card Rules is a supplement for Beak, Feather, & Bone that provides new rules for card play, hand management, and final scoring for the game. A copy of BFB is required to play.

The rules found here push the game further into the 'competitive' angle of map labeling. Hand management plays a role throughout the game, ultimately leading to a showdown at the end to see who has built up the best poker hand and won the right for their faction to take the Seat of Power.

The rules take up both sides of a half letter page so they can be printed out and stored with the lovely BFB zine.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Nameless Exhibition
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Nameless Exhibition (just “the Exhibition”, to those in the know) is an old tradition borne from Doskvol’s strong academic heritage and the whims of its nobles. It’s a secretive annual party where the city’s elite gather to be occult tourists, slumming it with the dangerous and arcane in a safe environment.

The Exhibition began in Nightmarket, but in the last few decades it’s moved to Ebongarde Manor in Six Towers. The Ebongarde family has since fallen and the manor is crumbling, but thanks to the Exhibition’s noble sponsors, it always has clean ﬂoors, a full pantry, and a powered laboratory on the day...

The Nameless Exhibition is a score/scenario for Blades in the Dark, with a few extra pages of NPCs for the GM to use.

boardgame.name: Flower Pit
フラワーピット
boardgame.description:
Flower Pit is a game for 2-4 players in which each player tries to earn the most points.

The game uses a stack of "seed" cards and "flower cards". Each square card shows a 2x2 grid of colored fields, with some of the cards having holes cut into the fields. Seed cards have the smallest size holes, and flower cards have larger holes is various shapes.

On their turn, a player chooses either a face up seed or flower card and places it on a communal field following various rules. If the player places a seed card, they'll earn points based upon contiguous groupings of a single color; if they've placed a flower card, they'll earn points based upon the number of levels to the flower.

Play continues until all seed and flower cards have been placed. Each player then reveals and scores a hidden "lucky" card, which will earn that player points for a certain color of field. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: GUN&SLINGER
boardgame.description:
GUN&SLINGER is an RPG geared for short, episodic sessions about a weapon and a wanderer. A Maestro and two players (Gun and Slinger) set out into a dead planet mutated by a god's forgotten child and hunt strange bounties, investigate the world and unlock hidden powers. During play, they seek to learn the nature of what’s hunting the Slinger, figure out why the Gun is sentient and discover how the world died.



Key Features


Tell the story of a post-magic world and the people working together to survive.
Explore the nature of a twisted reality and a force that hunts the players.
Answer Questions & Prompts at the table to establish a bespoke setting to adventure in.
Play with or without a gamemaster!
Mix and match any of the 7 unique character types and 3 unique settings to create a truly unique story that's all your own!
Roleplay using an entirely unique and intriguing resolution system: GO FISH!


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Ah, Dang! Mothman Won't Move Out (He Said It Was Just For The Weekend)
boardgame.description:
From the description:

When he showed up on your doorstep, you decided to let him crash here for a while. But he's overstaying his welcome, and you might be stuck with Mothman. And he’s definitely chewed on your dress shirt! It's time to help Mothman fix his problems so he'll stop hogging your couch!

Ah Dang! Mothman Won't Move Out (He Said It Was Just For The Weekend) is a sequel to Oh, Dang! Bigfoot Stole My Car With My Friend's Birthday Present Inside about trying to help Mothman, get him to move out, and maybe learn a little something on the way.
boardgame.rpg: Oh, Dang! Bigfoot Stole My Car With My Friend's Birthday Present Inside

boardgame.name: Uh, Dang! My E.T. Neighbour Is A Conspiracy Theory Guy
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You’re supposed to be setting up your place for a sweet birthday party. But your neighbour is coming, and they’ve been watching too many YouTube conspiracy videos! And they might be an extraterrestrial! Can you throw a birthday bash without them making it weird?

Uh, Dang! My E.T. Neighbour Is A Conspiracy Theory Guy is a sequel to Oh, Dang! Bigfoot Stole My Car With My Friend's Birthday Present Inside and Ah Dang! Mothman Won't Move Out (He Said It Was Just For The Weekend) about a birthday party that's out of this world.
boardgame.rpg: Oh, Dang! Bigfoot Stole My Car With My Friend's Birthday Present Inside

boardgame.name: Give Me Money or I'll Kick Your Cat
boardgame.description:
Give Me Money is the ultimate game of threats and payoffs.

The adult party game with no judges - no votes, just horrible threats for cold, hard cash.

This game is for adults only and contains material offensive to most people. If you find nothing in this game that offends you, you should probably consider therapy (and if you are already in therapy, you may want to up your dosage.

—description from the box

boardgame.name: The Clockwork Void
boardgame.description:
“It is said that nothing can come from nothing. In a world of The Void, this is not quite correct: everything comes from nothing.”


With a storyline that will take beginner Slayers all the way through to max level, the Clockwork Void provides an enriched setting for The City - and a framework campaign around which to play Hunts. With almost 30 pages of content, there's new Districts to explore, new factions to meet, and a mystery to solve; all of which create an environment in which player's choices will have lasting impacts that could ripple through The City forever.

So come, all you Slayers – there's a world that awaits you.

Can you save it, before the final clock strikes?

Source: The Game Website.
